text.tspan: If the Blattas believe they are at a
disadvantage against their opponent, they will
choose to retreat and avoid engagement. They
have a strong understanding of their own
limitations, and are not willing to risk their
members' lives needlessly. Even in unfavorable
battle conditions, they are able to minimize
casualties and prioritize the safety of their
group.
Blattas is a group that relies on surprise
attacks to compensate for their low
combat power. They mostly target
untrained groups and use pre-war firearms
as their weapons. However, due to a lack
of weapons, not all members of the group
are equipped with firearms, further
diminishing their fighting ability.
Lahar's leadership skills are highly valued by the orphans, but if his decisions
don't align with their expectations, they may become rebellious. The majority of
Blattas members are teenagers who are impulsive and don't think about long-
term consequences, which makes them difficult to manage.
Blattas have been able to grow their group to nearly 100 people
thanks to Lahar's ability to locate sources of water. Instead of
wandering aimlessly through the wilderness, Lahar realized that it was
more effective to target and attack water sources where other
survivors gathered. The group has survived through plundering and
has no permanent residence.
Lahar has developed survival
skills, including the ability to
conserve resources and survive
in confined spaces, through his
experiences in the cave.
He also learned how to take
the lives of others in order to
survive. Using these principles,
he leads a small group through
the wilderness by stealing from
other survivors and
distributing the items among
his "family."
Lahar himself survived
the nuclear winter in a
cave full of corpses,
along with a few
children.
They discovered their
identity through the
cave's totem and the
hieroglyphics written
on the wall.
Blattas is a group of orphans who will do
anything to survive. The group's name, which
means desert cockroach, reflects their leader
Lahar's belief that survival is the only motivation
in an apocalyptic world.
Lahar formed the group Blattas
in the early days of the post-
war, when many wandering
orphans had no access to food,
water, or shelter in the
wasteland. Most of these
children were likely to die in
the desert or grassland, but
Lahar brought them together
and gave them a chance to
survive and thrive.
The name Blattas was chosen to
symbolize their new beginnings
and the hope for a better life.
Their determination and willingness to fight
bare-handed make them a formidable force,
even for the empire. It would be a formidable
challenge to face them head-on.
The Caballeros are known for their
impressive fighting skills and their
commitment to justice.
They only see the Fidelian Empire as their
enemy and view all other groups as
needing enlightenment. Despite this, they
are willing to fight for their family and for
vengeance.
While their primary weapon is firearms,
they are also ready to use other weapons
if necessary. Despite the post-war era's
focus on firearms, the Caballeros
prioritize aesthetics over practicality.
The Caballeros organization values symbolism and can
often be found near crumbling cathedrals or cemeteries.
They travel on fast motorcycles and cars decorated with
European knightly designs and often wear anachronistic
iron armor.
As such, they are unwilling to form
equal relationships with any other
factions and will fiercely attack those
who try, even if they are not affiliated
with the empire.
The Caballeros work as a private security force in their
territory, similar to the Japanese Yakuza who were
connected to local authorities or civilians in the pre-war
period. However, this does not mean that the Caballeros
see all other groups as equals; rather, they view
themselves as the sole source of justice and protection.
The Caballeros are an anti-imperial
army that does not seek conflict with
non-imperial civilians. They have a
special relationship with nearby
survivor groups, offering protection
from the Fidelian Empire, desert
raiders, and other looters in the
wilderness.
The Caballeros is an organization
led by Morales Fiago, a Spanish-
American, that was formed in the
aftermath of the nuclear winter.
While the Fidelian Empire views
the Caballeros as gangsters, they
see themselves as the guardians of
justice who stand against the
unjust empire.
One major drawback is that replacing their
troops is almost impossible when they suffer
losses on the battlefield. This is because
Zaikasha is made up of soldiers with
exceptional and unique individual abilities,
who were primarily trained while in the
empire.
Essentially, if even one member of Zaikasha is
lost, it leads to irreparable and permanent
weakening of the unit.
Zaikasha is a specialized unit designed for
missions requiring a high level of
organizational combat power, such as
infiltrating enemy lines and assassinating
key figures.
While they are individually skilled
fighters, when they work together as a
group, their abilities are multiplied.
Zaikasha is composed of soldiers with
exceptional and unique individual
abilities, who were primarily trained while
in the empire.
Rio is careful with issuing orders, as the members of
Zaikasha are expected to follow every single one of
his commands, even if it may put their lives at risk.
Despite having the freedom to express their opinions
and disagree with Rio, they still follow his orders
without question.
The Resistance, led by Rio, establishes shelters in abandoned
buildings in the desert and works to gain more resources
through negotiations with other groups.
They have a military-style plan for securing resources and
managing tasks such as food procurement and shelter security,
and they may take on mercenary-like missions at times.
Rio was made the leader of
the organization due to his
charisma, which inspired
many members of his direct
unit to follow him and join
the Resistance.
However, he cannot handle
all decision-making on his
own, so the units under his
command are divided into
smaller platoons to distribute
his responsibilities.
However, Jake’s policy of running the empire was far from what Rio
had envisioned. Disagreeing with Jake's approach to leading the
empire, Rio gathered his loyal followers and fled to create the
Resistance group.
The unit was founded by Rio
Crassus, a former officer in the
Fidelian Empire. Crassus, a young
and talented soldier, played a crucial
role in the early days of the empire
through his exceptional tactical
command and strategic planning.
The Zaikasha unit is an elite unit
of the Fidelian Empire, made up
of soldiers who have undergone
rigorous training to carry out
specialized missions. Each
member is skilled and has
experience in their particular
role within the unit.
